H0.text: Freshwater biomes are biomes that have water containing little or no salt.

H1.text: Coastal biomes are types of biomes that have water containing little or no salt.

H2.text: Aquatic biomes are biomes that have water containing little or no salt.

H3.text: Marine biomes are biomes that have water containing little or no salt.

A4.text: Freshwater ecosystems are a subset of Earth's aquatic ecosystems that include the biological communities inhabiting freshwater waterbodies such as lakes, ponds, rivers, streams, springs, bogs, and wetlands.

A5.text: Freshwater ecosystems can be contrasted with marine ecosystems, which have a much higher salinity.
